articles.description: There was once a time when Scottish football enjoyed sufficient confidence to stand on its own two feet.

articles.description: What was exercising the minds of Celtic supporters precisely two years ago can make that time seem as if it belongs to another age altogether.

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: If Celtic do go onto lift their fifth treble in seven years next month, as so many expect will happen, an unlikely figure can be deemed to have played a part in the process.

articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou is adamant that 25 years of hard work have taken him to the cusp of landing a domestic treble in his second season in charge of the club and that the notion of luck should not enter the conversation.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou on what got him Celtic job as he reveals term to never use for Rangers boss - or anyone else

articles.description: Police Scotland will have increased powers to tackle the use of pyrotechnics come the Scottish Cup final at the start of June, the Scottish Government has confirmed.
articles.title: Scottish Government in 'further measures' promise to police for tackling pyro after Rangers v Celtic smoke

articles.description: Don Robertson earned praise from two former referees for how he handled the Rangers v Celtic Scottish Cup semi-final and why he was correct not to show John Lundstram a red card.
articles.title: Rangers star's tackle 'might have been red' v Celtic as ex-ref makes 'another referee' claim, Robertson praise

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: The SPFL will not request clubs play ‘God Save the King’ ahead of this weekend’s fixtures to mark the coronation of King Charles as the Premier League have in England.
articles.title: No SPFL request for teams to play 'God Save the King' to mark coronation weekend as clubs to decide

articles.description: Celtic’s 1-0 Scottish Cup semi-final win over Rangers secured by a first-half Jota header was an outcome that came with major repercussions.

articles.description: Celtic watched forward Levi Garcia in action once more ahead of a possible summer transfer, according to reports.
articles.title: The 37-cap international forward wanted by Celtic and 13 other teams, chasing 20 goals for the season

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: There was good news and bad news as Celtic edged a step closer to claiming the domestic treble. The Parkhead side saw off challengers Rangers to move into the Scottish Cup final, where they will face Championship side Inverness Caledonian Thistle, but manager Ange Postecoglou then revealed that man of the match Cameron Carter-Vickers will sit out the remainder of the season as he undergoes surgery for a knee injury.
articles.title: 'I love him, he deserves to be pain free, he's a person': Joe Hart is glad news is out about walking wounded Celtic talisman

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: There were mysteries to be interrogated in the over-arching ordinariness of Celtic as they stayed fair for total supremacy within the Scottish game.
articles.title: Why this win was so un-Celticy, their Bermuda Triangle and mad stat against Rangers

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Mayday will have very different connotations for Michael Beale when he wakes up at the start of this week. It might equal a Spring bank holiday for most people.
articles.title: A Celtic defeat too far for Rangers - players waved away, different ways to pile on heartache

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou joked that the menacing nature of Cameron Carter-Vickers meant he couldn’t send the centre-back for necessary surgery ahead of the Scottish Cup semi-final victory over Rangers that has placed the club on the brink of a treble.

articles.description: At Hampden Park, aged 34, Billy Mckay not only demonstrated his longevity but continued to write his own story as one of Scottish football’s finest strikers across the last 12 years. Two goals in a 3-0 Scottish Cup semi-final win for Inverness CT over Falkirk took him to 100 for the Highlanders and sets up a Scottish Cup final with either Celtic or Rangers.
